Sr. Manager, Product Design

at Slack in San Francisco, CA from 2/21/2021

We are hiring a Senior Product Design Manager to lead the design team in charge of systems and experiences across mobile and desktop that make Slack simpler to use and easier to build for.

Product Design Managers serve a vital role at Slack: they elevate the health, growth, and development of their team, as well as care for the overall business. They have a passion for design excellence expressed through thoughtful creative direction and occasionally rolling up their sleeves to lead by example.

Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture. We appreciate design leaders who are curious, humble, think deeply, speak clearly, and thrive on collaboration and feedback. If this sounds like a good fit for you, send us a nice hello with links to your work and experience.

Responsibilities

Leading a team of Product Designers focused on Slackâ€™s anatomy, information architecture, interaction models, our design System SlackKit and accessibility.
Working with product and engineering and other cross-functional partners to drive design vision and strategy. Help turn business objectives into customer centered problems and steer team strategy.
Creating flexible and scalable frameworks and guidelines for other teams and companies to build features on Slack
Designing, guiding and driving collaboration processes.
Setting a high bar for quality and help teams ship with that quality, without compromising velocity
Meeting regularly with designers to provide and gather feedback on project progress
Coaching, mentoring and providing career development, work satisfaction and happiness to your team.
Ensuring that projects are properly staffed based on scope, skills and timing.
Define and drive design hiring goals. Recruit and interview new Product Designers, review incoming candidates, and actively improve our design hiring process.

Skills

2+ years of experience in a role managing a team of designers.
Extensive and relevant work experience developing systems for desktop or mobile.
A demonstrable foundation in typography, interaction design, visual design, and design ideation.
Experience leading and collaborating with diverse teams in a dynamic, rapid growth environment.
Experience leading design studios, design sprints, team brainstorming and ideation exercises.
A nuanced understanding of diverse and inclusive hiring practices.
Experience with prototyping as a means to explore and convey design solutions.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
